sentences.en: A disco isn't exactly a den of iniquity.
sentences.cn: 迪斯科舞厅并非藏污纳垢之处。
适宜跳舞的迪斯科强节奏

sentences.en: A sit-down dinner was followed by a disco.
sentences.cn: 晚宴之后播放了一曲迪斯科舞曲。
你能找到迪斯科舞厅 吗 ?

sentences.en: Come to the New Year disco and bring your partner!
sentences.cn: 携伴来参加新年迪斯科舞会吧！
我对迪斯科舞不感兴趣.

sentences.en: Fridays and Saturdays are regular disco nights.
sentences.cn: 周五和周六是固定的迪斯科之夜。

sentences.en: Guests bopped and jigged the night away to the disco beat.
sentences.cn: 客人们整个晚上随着迪斯科的节奏跳博普舞和吉格舞。

sentences.en: I'm not going to the disco: it's just not my scene.
sentences.cn: 我不想去跳 迪斯科 舞,我完全不感兴趣.

sentences.en: Let's invite her to the disco — she needs distraction.
sentences.cn: 我们请她去迪斯科舞会 吧,她需要散散心.

sentences.en: Teenage disco music pumped out at every station.
sentences.cn: 每一站都喧闹地播放着十几岁少年所喜爱的劲爆迪斯科音乐。

sentences.en: The disco bouncer threw out four drunk teenagers.
sentences.cn: 迪斯科舞厅的保镖把四个酒醉的青少年赶出去.

sentences.en: Their national distraction is going to the disco.
sentences.cn: 他们的全民消遣就是去蹦迪。

sentences.en: This disco is a magnet for young people.
sentences.cn: 这家迪斯科舞厅经常吸引大批年轻的顾客.

sentences.en: When you say disco music is delightful, I snuggle up and listen.
sentences.cn: 你说迪斯科音乐好听, 我也凑上来听听.

trans.tran_en: a place or social event at which people dance to recorded popular music
